title: Sources: Pack likely to extend both LaFleur, GM
content: The Packers are working to bring back coach Matt LaFleur and GM Brian Gutekunst, and the expectation is that there will be contract extensions for both, league sources told ESPN.

title: Miami fine with underdog role once more vs. IU
content: Being the underdog has been Miami's "story the whole playoffs," Rueben Bain Jr. said, a part the Hurricanes have been cast in one more time against No. 1 Indiana for the national championship.

title: Carrick to Man Utd after derby: Let's keep it up
content: Michael Carrick has challenged his Manchester United players to keep it up after stunning Manchester City in his first game in charge.

title: Mensah's candidates: Duke QB late add to portal
content: Duke starting quarterback Darian Mensah is entering the transfer portal. Mensah's decision comes less than a month after he chose to return to school instead of entering the NFL draft.

title: Utah transfer Moa follows Whittingham, picks U-M
content: Former Utah signee Salesi Moa, ESPN's No. 6 wide receiver in the 2026 class, will sign with Michigan, following new Wolverines coach Kyle Whittingham.

title: OSU's Johnson granted TRO, can play immediately
content: Ohio State has added Penn State transfer Puff Johnson to its roster after he was granted a temporary restraining order for immediate eligibility.

title: Seahawks coach 'really optimistic' Darnold plays
content: Seahawks coach Mike Macdonald says he is "really optimistic" Sam Darnold will play against the 49ers despite a new oblique injury.

title: Sources: Miami eyeing Mexico striker Berterame
content: Inter Miami is prepared to pay the $15 million release clause for Monterrey forward Germ√°n Berterame, sources told ESPN.

content: Bills-Broncos. 49ers-Seahawks. Texans-Patriots. Rams-Bears. We have picks, stats to know, X factors and more for the divisional round.

content: Buffalo has shown that winning games without an obvious top WR is possible with the All-Pro QB at the helm.

content: Thirteen Dukes players followed Curt Cignetti to become Hoosiers. Those who remain are on the verge of CFB history.

content: Manchester City's title bid is as good as over after Manchester United won the midfield battle at Old Trafford. It's the same story in the title race.

content: Shanahan took a different approach to 2025 -- and it has the 49ers two games away from the Super Bowl.

content: Is the ACC back? Eight single-digit seeds -- including one on the top line -- and a couple of bubble teams would suggest so.

title: Women's: South Carolina ascends to No. 2 overall
content: Texas, which fell at South Carolina on Thursday, tumbles to the final No. 1 seed after its second straight loss.

content: Madison Keys and Jannik Sinner are the Australian Open defending champs -- can either win again? Our experts make predictions.

content: The Bucks and Antetokounmpo currently sit in 11th place ahead of the trade deadline. What are their options?

content: Will the Hoosiers cap an undefeated season, or can the Canes pull off a stunner? Here are the keys to the game.

content: The transfer portal closes today for most players. Here are five things to know after two wild weeks.

content: These players selfishly betrayed their common sense, their teammates and, ultimately, themselves, Wetzel says.

content: Prosecutors allege a gambling ring bribed 39 NCAA players to fix dozens of games. Here's a closer look.

content: Odds, game picks, prop plays, betting advice and daily fantasy tips for the Texans-Patriots divisional round matchup.

content: Even as beards freeze and fingers lose feeling, NFL players find ways to handle ridiculously cold temperatures.

content: Who are the best players in this year's NFL draft class? Which receivers have first-round talent? Field Yates stacks his top 25 board.

content: Barcelona teenager Dro Fern√°ndez is wanted by Chelsea and Manchester City among others. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Transfer window weekly: G√ºler to Arsenal? Chelsea squad changes?
content: The winter transfer window is open, so what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done?

title: Keep, cut or add? What to do with these eight rising and falling players
content: Steve Alexander highlights fantasy basketball names trending upward or downward, and explains whether they should be added or cut from your roster.

title: Victor Wembanyama, Keldon Johnson shaved each other's heads following loss to OKC
content: Spurs center Victor Wembanyama and forward Keldon Johnson showed up to shoot around on Thursday with bald heads.

title: Did soft Hindutva hit Uddhav hard? Behind the setback of ‚ÄòThackeray brand‚Äô in BMC
content: The Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray) and Raj Thackeray's Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) combine had framed the BMC polls as a battle to ‚Äúsave the Marathi manoos and Mumbai, projecting the contest as both an assertion of regional pride and a referendum on the Thackeray legacy. ‚ÄãThe reunion of Uddhav Thackeray and Raj Thackeray after nearly two decades was billed as an acid test for the Thackeray brand.

title: 'World peace at stake': Trump charges Europe with 10% tariff; charged over Greenland control
content: President Trump announced a 10% tariff on goods from several European nations, escalating to 25% if Denmark does not agree to sell Greenland by June 1, 2026. He cited security concerns and inadequate "remuneration" from allies for decades of US protection, demanding Denmark "give back" for past subsidies.

title: IndiGo flight disruptions: DGCA imposes Rs 22.20cr fine for Dec crisis; airline responds
content: IndiGo faces a hefty Rs 22.20 crore penalty from DGCA for massive flight disruptions in early December 2025, stranding over three lakh passengers. The regulator cited over-optimisation, poor planning, and FDTL non-compliance. IndiGo's top management received warnings, and a Rs 50 crore bank guarantee is mandated for systemic reforms.

title: U19 WC: 8 wickets in eight overs! India snatch victory from Bangladesh's grasp
content: Vihaan Malhotra's brilliant 4/14 spell triggered a dramatic Bangladesh collapse, securing an 18-run DLS victory for India in a rain-hit Under 19 World Cup match. Despite a strong start in their chase, Bangladesh faltered against Malhotra's spin, falling short of the revised target. Earlier, Kundu and Sooryavanshi anchored India's innings.

title: Zuckerberg hired Wang for $14bn ‚Äî now they‚Äôre clashing
content: Meta's new structure reveals tension between Mark Zuckerberg and Alexandr Wang, the $14 billion AI recruit. Wang finds Zuckerberg's micromanagement stifling, while staff question his leadership for Meta's AI ambitions. A recent strategy clash highlighted differing priorities, with Wang pushing for cutting-edge AI over immediate product integration.

title: 'Life-and-death election for them': Uddhav alleges coercion, kidnapping in BMC polls
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) president Uddhav Thackeray alleged intimidation and coercion by the ruling alliance in the BMC elections, calling it a "strange" contest for political survival. Despite the Mahayuti alliance's majority, Thackeray asserted the resilience of his party, thanking voters for their support amidst alleged pressure.

title: ‚ÄòBoard of Peace‚Äô in chaos? Netanyahu pushes back on Trump's Gaza governing body
content: Israel's Prime Minister Netanyahu publicly criticized the US administration's Gaza governance plan, citing a lack of coordination and inclusion of figures like Turkey's foreign minister.  He instructed his foreign minister to raise concerns with the US Secretary of State, highlighting a rare open disagreement with the White House over the newly announced "Gaza Executive Board" and its composition.

title: ‚ÄòNo chess on a dead planet‚Äô: Protest disrupts Wijk aan Zee tourney - watch
content: The Tata Steel Chess Tournament in Wijk aan Zee was briefly delayed after climate activists from Extinction Rebellion dumped 2,025 kg of coal at the venue, accusing sponsor Tata Steel of pollution and ‚Äúsportswashing.‚Äù Protesters highlighted alleged carbon and lead emissions, while organisers defended the event‚Äôs sporting and cultural value, urging respect and safety as the tournament resumed under heightened coordination with authorities.

title: No coding? Nvidia CEO wants calls to free engineers from 'syntax'; want focus on issues
content: Nvidia's CEO Jensen Huang aims for engineers to code zero percent, leveraging AI assistants like Cursor to tackle complex, undiscovered problems. He believes this 'Purpose vs Task' approach, akin to radiology's evolution, will elevate human roles. While some, like Cursor's CEO, caution against unchecked AI development, Huang remains confident in this human-centric future for innovation.

title: Pollution crisis: GRAP-IV reimposed in Delhi-NCR; air quality slips to ‚Äòsevere‚Äô category
content: Delhi-NCR's air quality has plunged into the 'severe' category, prompting the Commission for Air Quality Management to reimpose GRAP-IV restrictions. This escalation follows the earlier enforcement of GRAP-III.  Under Stage IV, older vehicles like BS-III petrol and BS-IV diesel models are banned from plying, with exceptions for essential services.  Existing GRAP measures remain in effect.

title: BMC polls setback: Congress leader demands Mumbai unit chief's resignation; gets party notice
content: Mumbai Congress faces internal turmoil after a dismal BMC election performance, its worst ever. Senior leaders are demanding city president Varsha Gaikwad's resignation, citing moral grounds. Despite the setback, party spokespersons defend the outcome, attributing it to adverse circumstances and alleged misuse of power by rivals. The party plans organizational strengthening amidst simmering dissent.

title: Cabello in talks with US before Maduro raid? Is Rodriguez‚Äôs position at risk
content: Venezuela's interim President Delcy Rodriguez is consolidating power after Maduro's seizure, appointing loyalists and seeking US backing. However, she faces a significant internal threat from Interior Minister Diosdado Cabello, who has close ties to security forces and motorcycle gangs. Rodriguez navigates this delicate balance while addressing economic instability and internal dissent.

title: Kevin O‚ÄôLeary‚Äôs warning for US on China: America lacks grid for AI surge; China adds 500 GW
content: Kevin O'Leary, a prominent Canadian investor, voices a concerning warning about the AI surge in America: it's on a collision course with an energy crisis. He points out that while China's energy infrastructure is evolving rapidly‚Äîwith an impressive addition of 500 gigawatts‚Äîthe U.S. has shockingly added 'zero.

title: Canada cosies up to China: Mark Carney strikes key deals with Xi Jinping; why Trump will be furious
content: Canada's Prime Minister Mark Carney has forged a significant trade deal with China, lowering tariffs on canola oil and electric vehicles. This landmark agreement signals a thawing of diplomatic ties after years of strain and aims to diversify Canada's trade away from the United States, a move potentially influenced by recent US trade uncertainties.

title: History of India‚Äôs Union Budgets - Some Budgets that became blueprints for institutional change
content: Union Budgets are often treated as routine fiscal announcements, yet in recent four decades they have quietly reshaped taxation, regulation and economic policy. Why did finance ministers repeatedly use the Budget to dismantle the licence raj, build market institutions and enforce fiscal rules‚Äîand why does that legacy still shape India‚Äôs political economy today? The answers lie in how the Budget became a tool of structural reform.

title: Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt's heartfelt life update amid team's tough season
content: The Kansas City Chiefs had a pretty disappointing season this time, but the billionaire heiress, Gracie Hunt, has always been there for the team. Amid all the mess, Gracie Hunt has made a wholesome post about her life along with a few inspirational words that has moved fans. With the team's poor performance, many of their players are also getting trolled brutally.

title: Steelers nation demands change after Tomlin's steelers exit
content: Steelers Nation has accepted Mike Tomlin's departure after nearly two decades, with a poll showing 64.79% of fans believing it was the right decision. While acknowledging his past success and Super Bowl title, fans expressed frustration with recent playoff disappointments and conservative play-calling. Tomlin is reportedly considering a move to television.

title: Stephen Curry pens 'keep shooting' for Klay Thompson's 3-point mark
content: Klay Thompson has officially become the NBA's fourth all-time leader in three-pointers, surpassing Damian Lillard with 2,805 made.  This remarkable achievement, despite past injuries, drew praise from former teammate Stephen Curry.  The duo, once a legendary backcourt, continues to share mutual respect and support even after Thompson's move to Dallas.

title: Delhi: NRI doctors duped of Rs 15cr; how ‚Äòdigital arrest‚Äô kept couple trapped
content: Three individuals have been apprehended in connection with the Rs 15 crore "digital arrest" of an NRI doctor couple in Delhi. The accused, including two who provided bank accounts and one facilitator, are being investigated for links to China- and Cambodia-based scammers.  Significant portions of the defrauded money were channeled through various business entities.

title: Beyond the badge: The unseen burden of independent Indian women
content: Modern Indian women are celebrated as independent, yet this often masks exhaustion from constant negotiation and performance.  Once a thrilling discovery, independence now carries immense pressure, demanding visible strength and early responsibility.  This evolution highlights a generational truth: independence is expected early, learned through observing the sacrifices of others, and often met with criticism.

title: ICC under pressure? Bangladesh demands last-minute T20 World Cup switch
content: Bangladesh Cricket Board has formally requested the ICC to swap its T20 World Cup 2026 group with Ireland, aiming to play matches in Sri Lanka due to security concerns in India. The ICC delegation visited Dhaka to address these worries and advocate for the original schedule, but the board remains firm on its request.

title: NYC heist: Gunmen take 'gotta catch ‚Äôem all' too seriously; Pok√©mon cards worth $100k stolen
content: Armed robbers stormed a Manhattan Pok√©mon card shop, making off with rare collectibles worth over $100,000. The brazen heist, which lasted only three minutes, saw thieves smash a display case and grab high-value cards, including a first-edition Charizard. This incident highlights a growing trend of Pok√©mon card thefts across the US, driven by their increasing value as investments.

title: Peanut lodged in the lung, oxygen at 40%: Two infants narrowly escape death in Faridabad
content: Two Faridabad infants narrowly escaped death after accidentally inhaling food particles, leading to critical respiratory failure. Doctors at Amrita Hospital performed emergency procedures, removing a peanut from one-year-old's airway and using advanced cryotherapy for an eight-month-old's lodged object. Timely, specialized intervention saved both lives, highlighting the dangers of foreign body aspiration in infants.

title: 24 is panicking, 34 is exhausted: The fears of young India in 2026
content: India's youth, comprising millennials and Gen Z, face distinct anxieties shaped by differing political, economic, and technological landscapes. While millennials fear instability after years of effort, Gen Z grapples with the prospect of never achieving stability. Both generations navigate concerns over job security, economic inequality, and climate change, highlighting a cautious outlook on their future.

title: 'Didn't want to screw up': Steve Smith breaks silence on Babar Azam BBL row
content: Steve Smith's tactical decision to deny Babar Azam a single during a crucial power surge ultimately paid off as Smith smashed a record-breaking 32 runs in the subsequent over. Despite Babar's visible frustration, Smith's aggressive batting secured a five-wicket win for the Sydney Sixers, with Smith going on to score a century.

title: Chinnaswamy Stadium set to host IPL and international cricket again; K'taka govt gives nod
content: Bengaluru's M. Chinnaswamy Stadium is set to host international and IPL cricket once again. The Karnataka Home Department has granted formal permission to the Karnataka State Cricket Association, ending a period of uncertainty following a tragic stampede during last year's IPL celebrations. This clearance allows the iconic venue to gradually rejoin the cricketing calendar, marking a return to normalcy.

title: ‚ÄòSubject to judicial process‚Äô: Embassy on Indian crew detained in Iran; seeks ‚Äòconsular access‚Äô
content: India is actively engaging Iran to secure the release of 16 Indian crew members detained on the MT Valiant Roar since December. New Delhi is pressing for consular access, communication with families, and legal representation, while also ensuring the vessel's provisions. The detention follows Iran's seizure of the tanker for alleged illegal fuel transport.

title: Side hustle ends a Google career: Why this Bengaluru engineer was forced to quit
content: The resignation of Google engineer Arpit Bhayani over his educational side work has become a symbol of a deeper shift in India‚Äôs tech workforce. As freelancing surges and moonlighting checks tighten, companies and employees are drifting out of sync. The story reflects a growing tension between rigid corporate rules and a workforce that has quietly embraced flexible, parallel careers.

title: 'BJP won polls by betrayal': Uddhav's 1st address after BMC drubbing, says 'battle not over'
content: Following BMC election results, Uddhav Thackeray asserted Shiv Sena (UBT) remains strong despite BJP's alleged betrayal and attempts to buy loyalty. The Thackeray-led alliance secured significant wins in Mumbai's Marathi heartland, though they lost control of the BMC after nearly three decades to the Mahayuti alliance.

title: 'Axar is way ahead of Jadeja': Ex-India cricketer's blunt verdict
content: Ravindra Jadeja's ODI form is under scrutiny due to quiet performances with bat and ball, with recent numbers raising questions. Mohammad Kaif believes Axar Patel is a superior option in white-ball cricket, citing batting prowess and bowling versatility. Kaif also questioned team selection, advocating for Axar's inclusion over Nitish Kumar Reddy for better balance.

title: 'Asli poriborton': PM Modi says TMC converting 'infiltrators into voters' in Bengal - what he said
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed a rally in Malda, West Bengal, advocating for "asli poribortan" and criticizing the Mamata Banerjee-led Trinamool Congress. He highlighted BJP's recent poll victories in Bihar, Odisha, and Assam, stating these states have been freed from "divisive politics." Modi expressed confidence in Bengal's "urge for real change" to achieve a developed India by 2047.

title: ‚ÄòNo entry for non-Hindus‚Äô: Har ki Pauri boards cite century-old bylaw; officials say no fresh order
content: New notice boards citing a century-old bylaw restricting non-Hindus at Har-ki-Pauri have been installed by the Ganga Sabha. The body aims to enforce rules framed in 1916, stating only those connected to Sanatan Dharma should enter the holy site. While the Ganga Sabha seeks wider implementation, district officials emphasize that enforcement depends on civic authorities and adherence to the law.

title: Sunjay Kapur inheritance row: Priya Sachdev files criminal defamation case against Mandhira
content: In a fresh escalation of the ongoing legal battle over late businessman Sunjay Kapur‚Äôs estate, his widow Priya Sachdev Kapur has filed a criminal defamation complaint against Sunjay‚Äôs sister, Mandhira Kapur Smith, and another individual.

title: JEE Main 2026 admit card released: Check direct link, how to access session 1 hall ticket here
content: The National Testing Agency has released the JEE Main 2026 January session admit card on its official website. Candidates can download their hall tickets using their application number and date of birth. The January session exams are scheduled from January 21 to January 29, 2026, with the second session in April.

title: B'desh: Journalists demand protection after attacks on national dailies; slam Yunus govt
content: Bangladesh journalists and media owners are demanding safety after violent mob attacks on major newspapers.  Staff were trapped as offices were torched and looted.  Concerns are mounting over press freedom and democratic institutions ahead of elections, with critics pointing to the interim government's slow response and broader issues of harassment and surveillance.

title: BBL: Embarrassment for Pakistan; Babar, Rizwan top unwanted list
content: Pakistan stars Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan endured a tough BBL 2026, topping the list of the slowest batters with strike rates of 107.48 and 102.74. Babar‚Äôs frustration was visible after a mid-pitch clash with Steve Smith, before his dismissal. Rizwan, meanwhile, became the first overseas player in BBL history to be retired out, highlighting concerns over their T20 tempo.

title: Salman was happiest with Aishwarya during this film; Kumar Sanu reveals
content: Singer Kumar Sanu recently revealed that Salman Khan was exceptionally happy during the filming of 'Hum Dil De Chuke Sanam.' He described both Salman and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan as incredibly beautiful, noting their real-life chemistry translated powerfully on screen. Sanu's comments highlight the enduring impact of their pairing in the iconic 1999 film.

title: U.P. CM Adityanath accuses Congress of spreading ‚Äòfalse propaganda‚Äô on Kashi redevelopment
content: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister says Kashi is witnessing unprecedented spiritual, cultural and infrastructural transformation over the past 11 years, with a sharp rise in pilgrim footfall and major contributions to the economy

title: Punjab CM meets Amit Shah, opposes Seeds Bill 2025
content: Chief Minister Mann said that despite clear statutory provisions under the relevant Punjab Acts, Rural Development Fund has not been reimbursed to the State government

title: SIT expedites probe into death of Bihar NEET aspirant
content: The 18-year-old was found unconscious in her hostel room in Patna earlier this month and died during treatment on January 11; sexual violence can‚Äôt be ruled out,  post-mortem report says

title: Cleaning up the sins of the Opposition: PM in Assam
content: At an event to celebrate Bodo heritage, PM says Opposition exploited problems for their political benefit, treating infiltrators as a loyal votebank, and sowing division where there should have been trust

title: Modi govt. communalising education, says Congress
content: Party seeks probe into withdrawal of permission for MBBS course at Jammu‚Äôs Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Institute and the demolition of a school built by a Muslim in Madhya Pradesh

title: Madhya Pradesh government to build memorial at the site of Bhopal gas tragedy: CM Yadav
content: Chief Minister Mohan Yadav targets the Congress, accusing it of abandoning victims and helping former Union Carbide CEO Warren Anderson escape

title: Residents stage road blockade demanding capture of stray leopard
content: The leopard has killed at least seven head of cattle since December,¬†causing fear among residents and raising concerns over safety after dark. Forest officials say they are planning to set traps

title: Civic polls: BJP high command may override State unit‚Äôs resistance to alliance with JD (S)
content: The alliance with JD (S) was brokered by the high command with a larger perspective in mind, looking ahead at Assembly polls, says a strategist  SLUG: Civic polls

title: Rahul Gandhi calls for anti-discrimination law on Rohith Vemula‚Äôs death anniversary
content: The Congress leader says the situation facing Dalit students on campuses has not fundamentally changed, with institutionalised casteism, social exclusion and everyday humiliation continuing to deny equality of opportunity

title: RMC set to declare end of Northeast monsoon as rainfall activity wanes over T.N.
content: Officials of the RMC said conditions are turning favourable for cessation of monsoon rain over the south peninsular region, including Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, and Karaikal within two days

title: School arts festival sees its very first online contestant
content: Diagnosed with vasculitis L.K. Siya Fathima gets to contest in the Arabic Poster Designing competition. She secures ‚ÄôA‚Äô Grade

title: Kerala delegation at World Economic Forum
content: State will showcase its ongoing transformation into a knowledge-based economy and industry-friendly ecosystem at its space in the India Pavilion

title: In fresh controversy, Tipra Motha founder says he will ‚Äòrestore Tripura kingdom‚Äô
content: Royal scion Pradyot Kishore Manikya urged Tiprasa people to keep thansa (unity) among themselves to retrieve lost glory

title: Chinnaswamy Stadium gets conditional nod to host matches; crowd capacity to be decided after safety review
content: The government has retained the authority to inspect the stadium at any stage and to revise or withdraw the permission if the compliance or safety arrangements are found to be inadequate

title: Infiltration changing West Bengal‚Äôs demography: PM
content: PM assures refugees of protection under CAA, especially those from the Matua and Namasudras communities; accuses Trinamool of perpetuating illegal immigration, sparking riots

title: Cardiology department at SCTIMST celebrates its golden jubilee
content: Former heads of the department, current and former faculty members and cardiologists celebrate five decades of excellence in patient care and research.¬†

title: ED searches premises linked to Piyush Group in alleged real estate fraud case
content: Despite collecting substantial booking amounts, the promoters did not deliver on the projects as promised, it is alleged; more than 2,000 homebuyers are stated to have been affected

title: Kapali comes alive with AMB Cinemas: Revival or setback for Kannada cinema?
content: AMB Cinemas burst onto the Bengaluru scene, unveiling South India‚Äôs first Dolby Screen at the iconic Kapali Theatre, once a hotspot for Kannada films

title: Revanth says meeting Modi will continue in State‚Äôs interests
content: Chief Minister vows to complete all pending projects;  justifying his frequent visits to New Delhi for funds release saying that the give and take policy with the Centre would continue irrespective of what the Opposition claims

title: Huge support for tribal dances at Kerala school arts fest
content: Students from Govt. Model Residential School, Kulathupuzha, make their presence felt in the Irula Dance (Irula Nritham) competition

title: Kerala Kalolsavam 2026 | Bold narratives take centrestage in Drama competition
content: The HSS category featured performances bold in vision and rich in energy; escalating production costs of plays remain a concern

title: Trump Imposes 10% Tariff On Denmark, UK, France For Opposing Greenland Plan
content: US President Donald Trump on Saturday declared that he would charge a 10 per cent tariff on European countries because of their opposition to America's Greenland takeover.

title: 21-Year-Old Woman Mauled To Death By Leopard Near Sugarcane Field In UP
content: A 21-year-old woman was mauled to death by a leopard in the Nichlaul Range of the Sohgirwa Wildlife Sanctuary here on Saturday, officials said.

title: Woman, Her Lover Strangulate Husband To Death In UP: Cops
content: Uttar Pradesh Police here have arrested a woman and her lover on Saturday for allegedly strangulating her husband to death, officials said.

title: Drones Spotted In Jammu And Kashmir Again, 4th Time In A Week
content: Drones, suspected to be from Pakistan, were spotted at two locations in the Ramgarh sector of Samba district in Jammu and Kashmir on Saturday, the fourth such sighting in a week.

title: Bengaluru Excise Officials Demand Rs 80 Lakh Bribe For Brewery Licence, Caught
content: In a major anti-corruption operation, the Bengaluru Lokayukta has arrested three excise officials after catching them red-handed while allegedly accepting a Rs 25 lakh bribe. The payout was reportedly part of a much larger Rs 80 lakh demand.

title: "Unique Globally": Gautam Adani On Vishakha Group's Industrial Ecosystem
content: Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani on Saturday said that Vishakha Group's coordinated industrial ecosystem spanning solar glass, aluminium, polymer films and advanced materials represents a new model of Indian manufacturing.

title: Why Rs 6,950-Crore Kaziranga Elevated Corridor Is A Game Changer
content: Assam is set for a massive infrastructure boost as Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to perform the Bhoomi Pujan for the Kaziranga Elevated Corridor project on Sunday, January 18.

title: Chief Justice On Stage, Mamata Banerjee's 'Protect From Agencies' Appeal
content: Days after she set the cat among the pigeons by walking out with documents during Enforcement Directorate raids on political consultancy firm I-PAC, Mamata Banerjee has urged the Chief Justice to protect people from being "targeted" by agencies.

title: Singur Movement Changed Bengal's Politics, But Not Farmers' Lives
content: Singur, which changed the course of West Bengal politics in 2006, is once again at the centre of a controversy 18 years later. Back then the question was about why set up industry on fertile agricultural land.

title: From Child King To Heritage Pioneer: The Remarkable Journey Of Gaj Singh
content: The social and cultural consciousness of western Rajasthan has been dominated by the legacy of Jodhpur and its royal lineage. And in that is embedded the image of one man, Bapji. King at the age of four, yet deeply connected to the soul of Marwar.

title: IndiGo Fined Rs 22 Crore For Massive Flight Disruptions In December
content: The civil aviation regulator DGCA has imposed a penalty of Rs 22.20 crore on IndiGo and taken strict enforcement action against its senior management after a probe found serious planning, operational and regulatory lapses.

title: GRAP-4 Enforced In Delhi, Nearby Areas As AQI Crosses 400
content: The strictest pollution curbs under Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP-4) have been reimposed in Delhi-NCR as the AQI began inching towards 450, or the "severe+" category, on Saturday.

title: Search Underway For Indonesia Air Transport Plane With 10 On Board
content: Indonesian authorities are searching for a plane carrying three government workers and seven crew members after contact with the aircraft was lost on Saturday, officials said.

title: How Crores Were Siphoned From Pro-Poor Insurance Scheme In Madhya Pradesh
content: A sprawling insurance fraud network operating quietly across the Gwalior-Chambal belt has been exposed, revealing how crores of rupees meant for the poorest families were siphoned off by declaring the living as dead.

title: Delhi Records Minimum Temperature At 4.4 Degrees Celsius: Weather Office
content: The national capital on Saturday recorded a minimum temperature of 4.4 degrees Celsius, which was 3.2 notches below the season's average, according to the India Meteorological Department (IMD).

title: India Brings Money To America, Not Pakistan: US Lawmaker On New Delhi Ties
content: US Congressman Rich McCormick, a member of Trump's Republican party, said that unlike India, Pakistan does not bring investments to the United States and vice versa.

title: "People Free To Choose": Asaduddin Owaisi To NDTV On 'B-Team' Allegations
content: Taking allegations of being the 'B-Team' of the BJP head on, AIMIM President Asaduddin Owaisi has said the reason his party is doing well in states like Bihar and even the Maharashtra civic polls is that it actually has a gameplan to fight the BJP.

title: 19 Government Bills Pending In Rajya Sabha, Oldest Dates Back To 1992
content: As many as 19 government Bills remain pending in the Rajya Sabha, with the oldest, pertaining to population control, dating back to 1992.

title: Body Of 2nd Missing Kerala Tourist Recovered From Sela Lake In Arunachal
content: The body of a missing tourist from Kerala was recovered on Saturday from the frozen Sela Lake in Arunachal Pradesh's Tawang district following an intensive search operation.

title: 'There's No One With Me': 8-Year-Old Boy Takes Mother's Body To Hospital
content: An eight-year-old boy found himself alone at a hospital as he arranged the postmortem examination of his mother, who died of HIV-related infection, until local police stepped in to help him with legal formalities and the last rites.

title: DGCA slaps ‚Çπ22.2 crore penalty on IndiGo for flight cancellations after inquiry finds crew were being over stretched

title: Rams-Bears set to join list of coldest playoff games
content: temperatures could drop to single digits for divisional round game between los Angeles Rams and the Chicago Bears . if 2 degrees is where we end up, the Rams-Bears still won't be among the top five coldest playoff games . the 1967 NFL championship reigns supreme as the coldest postseason game .

title: All-Pro LBs to coaches: How Texans' Ryans, Patriots' Vrabel have revived former teams
content: deMeco Ryans' first season as coach of the Houston Texans was interrupted by a fan in a grocery store . he was drawn back by the success and renewed energy the former linebacker had brought to texans football . the fan said he had started watching football again, but he couldn't stomach the losing .

title: 2026 draft: Which underclassmen have declared?
content: the 2026 draft is three months away, so the class is starting to take shape . the deadline for underclassmen to declare for this draft class was January 14 . players from both teams meet in the college football playoff national championship .

title: Why Miami's Columbus High School can't lose the CFP title game
content: the "Get Up" team gives its national championship picks . the school is 5 miles from the University of Miami and 20 miles from Hard Rock Stadium . it's home to the Explorers, who have seven people representing the school .

title: 10 NBA teams that could swing trade season's final 20 days

title: How Darnold-to-Smith-Njigba fuels Seahawks' playoff run

title: MLB offseason grades: Mets pivot to Bichette after Dodgers sign top free agent Tucker
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . the deal: three years, $126 million with opt-outs after first two seasons Grade: B- The new york Mets have a new heart .
